Text: Sam Fryman is a complete nutcase and a loonie. This "book" is just crap.
Yes, that's why this work received 5 stars from readers as did so many other of Sam Fryman's works,  in fact the vast majority.

"Religions are all alike - founded upon fables and mythologies." - Thomas Jefferson

"The world is my country, all mankind are my brethren, and to do good is my religion."
? Thomas Paine

Thomas Edison


"It is said that men may not be the dreams of the Gods, but rather that the Gods are the dreams of men." - Carl Sagan

- George Santayana

?Although it is said that faith can move mountains, experience shows that dynamite works better.?

Ferdinand Magellan

"Religion is excellent stuff for keeping common people quiet." - Napoleon Bonaparte (and to rob them)

People who want to share their religious views with you almost never want you to share yours with them.
--Dave Barry 

"One of the greatest gifts science has brought to the world is continuing elimination of the supernatural."
? James D. Watson, Nobel laureate, co-discoverer of the molecular structure of DNA

"This crime called blasphemy was invented by priests for the purpose of defending doctrines not able to take care of themselves."
? Robert G. Ingersoll

People think that epilepsy is divine simply because they don't have any idea what causes epilepsy. But I believe that someday we will understand what causes epilepsy, and at that moment, we will cease to believe that it's divine. And so it is with everything in the universe.
--Hippocrates

The point is not that all religious people are bad; it is not that all bad things are done in the name of religion; and it is not that scientists are never 

bad, or wrong, or self-deceived. The point is this: intellectual honesty is better (more enlightened, more useful, less dangerous, more in touch with reality, etc. ) than dogmatism.
Sam Harris

Let's play, "Spot the logical fallacy"

Spirit_Helper: "Note the insolent foul mouthed commentators above. These kind of supporters that Dawkins has show what his real worth is - worse than nothing. He merely tries to persaude the sort of sick conflicted people who had commented on this page that they are OK. "

Guilt By Association, Composition (Part to whole): Even if we accept the premise that Dawkins supporters are "foul mouthed" and "sick" that has nothing to do with Dawkins himself.

Spirit_Helper: "And where is his genius? You have to invent something to be a genius like Einstein or Newton or Darwin."

Ad Hominem (and untrue): You do not have to invent something to be a genius but even if that were true what does that have to do with the information? Nothing. In addition the statement is false in that Dawkins has invented theories on evolutionary processes like how you can develop an eye bit by bit thus showing, logically, that irreducible complexity is an invalid argument.

Spirit_Helper: "What has Dawkins done of any value apart from slag off God, and tell 'free people' they have no right to believe in one? He is an arrogant, ignorant, insolent intellecutal tryant, as are the vast majority of his fans, as these comment here prove.

Ad Hominem ad infinitum: Address the information not the man.

If you wish to further your cause you must argue logically and not from emotion. As a true skeptic I've tried to argue both sides of the equation but when attempting to argue for Intelligent Design you get stuck at step one, show me the proof.  Evolution on the other hand has a virtually inexhaustible supply of evidence that builds on itself. In addition when new data comes up it fits into the puzzle very well. There has not been one piece of evidence to disprove evolution.

The only kind of evidence we found that disproves anything never disproves evolution but instead simply disproves a hypothesis we had on an evolutionary mechanism or usually a branching we incorrectly hypothesized.

In closing, an agnostic atheist (which is what Dawkins is, as am I) does not say there is no God. We simply say, "Show me the proof." Though we can say that there has been no proof whatsoever in the thousands of years of recorded history and that in itself is fairly good evidence that there is no omnipotent being or beings as describe in ancient bronze and iron age texts such as the Bible, Rigveda, Akilathirattu Ammanai, Quoran, The Book of the Dead, or any other religious text.

So, show us some proof first. Then we'll listen. And saying, "The bible says it's true because the bible is true because it says so" is not proof. It's a circular argument.

If there is a God I would think she would want you to argue using reason and logic not emotion. Do yourself and your religion a favor and at least learn to present your arguments in a rational, logical way so your message is heard instead of your dislike of the opposing argument.

"In closing, an agnostic atheist (which is what Dawkins is, as am I) does not say there is no God. We simply say, "Show me the proof." Though we can say that there has been no proof whatsoever in the thousands of years of recorded history and that in itself is fairly good evidence that there is no omnipotent being or beings as describe in ancient bronze and iron age texts such as the Bible, Rigveda, Akilathirattu Ammanai, Quoran, The Book of the Dead, or any other religious text.

So, show us some proof first. Then we'll listen."

According to the 'smelly' ToE (Theory of Evolution), all diversity of life can be traced back to 'common descent'. However, in all of the thousands of years of recorded history and the billions of years of fantasized history (make-believe), not one shred of proof has ever surfaced supporting the magic story of 'common descent'. Amazingly, cockroaches remain cockroaches and dodo birds...well, they just die off.

(For further proof, read about the coelacanthe fish and how this 'dinosaur' fish disproved completely the stinky ToE).
